turns.speaker: phone)
turns.transcript: Hello, Mother.

turns.speaker: Cooper
turns.transcript: Shelly! How’s my baby doing?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I just wanted to let you know that you can remove Amy from your nightly prayers. Unless you’re open to praying for a beehive to fall on her head.

turns.speaker: Cooper
turns.transcript: Oh, what’s going on?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: She broke up with me.

turns.speaker: Cooper
turns.transcript: Oh, Shelly.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: No, I’ll be okay. But I think that I’d like to send the ring back to you.

turns.speaker: Cooper
turns.transcript: Well, let’s not be hasty. Are you sure it’s over for good?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: It’s over for me. I’m done with women. Like when I swore off Pop Rocks. They both hurt you on purpose.

turns.speaker: Cooper
turns.transcript: You want to tell me what happened?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Are you going to say it’s all part of God’s plan?

turns.speaker: Cooper
turns.transcript: Good chance.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Then no, thank you.

turns.speaker: Cooper
turns.transcript: Well, honey, don’t send it back yet. Your sister’s married, and I’m not letting your brother give my grandmother’s ring to that whore he’s dating.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Wasn’t Mary Magdalene a woman of ill repute?

turns.speaker: Cooper
turns.transcript: When your idiot brother redeems mankind, he can date whoever he wants.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Wow. You know, the last time I saw my grandma, the most exciting thing was watching the ash of her cigarette get longer and wondering if it was gonna fall in her pudding.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Did it?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yeah, right in there. She ate it and everything.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: (Knock, knock, knock) Leonard and Penny. (Knock, knock, knock) Leonard and Penny. (Knock, knock, knock) Leonard and Penny.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Come in.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Hey. What happened? Is Amy gone?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: No. They asked me to leave so they could speak privately.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Uh-oh.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Yeah, I know. It was quite tense. So here’s the million dollar question, uh, who wants to pop over there and get my trains?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Hey, pretty lady.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, you seem extra happy.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Uh, I guess I am.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Any particular reason why?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I don’t know, just having a good day. This morning Sheldon fell asleep on the way to work, so I got to listen to the radio. That was pretty crazy.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Mm-hmm. Anything else?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Mm. I found this quiz online called Which Star Trek Character Are You? and it only took me four tries to get Captain Kirk.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: That’s great.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh. It. Was.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Hmm. Well, I’m glad you’re having such a great day.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Yeah. And the one thing that could make it even better is an evening with my special girl.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, and who’s that?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, I just didn’t know if you meant me or Alex.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Um, why would I mean Alex?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Because I know she hit on you and I know you liked it.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: What?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Don’t play dumb with me, Ricardo Shilly-Shally!

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I’m missing something. (Enters apartment. To Sheldon) Did you say something to Penny about Alex?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, yes. Yeah, and a fat lot of good it did me. All she did was get mad at you.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Why would you do that?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I needed advice about a woman. I would have asked you, but if the last few years have proven anything, it’s that you can’t tell a uterus from a unicycle.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: At least I know not to blab to a girl about somebody flirting with her boyfriend.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Good to know. Yeah, a few more helpful hints like that, you may find yourself on the Council of Ladies. (Answering phone) Hello. I see. Uh, what time? Very well, then. Huh. That was the Human Resources Department at the university. Apparently, my assistant Alex has filed a complaint accusing me of inappropriate behaviour in the workplace.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, my God, what did you do?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Hmm, let me think. Nothing. I’m a delight.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: It’s from Game of Thrones. What do you think?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I don’t know. If we’re going to start a fantasy sword collection, and I’ve long thought we should, is this really the sword to start with?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: What did you have in mind?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well, off the top of my head, I’d have to go with Excalibur. It gives you the right to rule England.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: It would be a replica of a movie prop.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Fair enough. It’d give you the right to rule a replica of England.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Well, they don’t have an Excalibur here, so what do you want to do?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Mm. Tough decision. There’s no weaponry from Lord of the Rings, forged in a Chinese sweatshop?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Just Bilbo Baggins’ sword over there.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Two grown men with a hobbit’s dagger; wouldn’t we look silly? Okay, let’s go for it.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Oh, I see you guys have found my little treasure.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Yeah. It’s okay, I guess.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Okay? It’s magnificent.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Buh-buh-buh-buh! What do you want for it?

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Oh, it’s hard to put a price on something that’s a copy of something that was on pay cable. But for my friends, let’s say 250?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, that’s pretty steep.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Well, it’s a limited edition. They only made 8,000 of these bad boys.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Only 8,000? We’re wasting precious time. Buy it.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Hang on. Can you do any better?

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Are you kidding? I’m already giving you the friends and family discount.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, did you hear that? We’re getting the friends and family discount. We are honoured and we will take it.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Slow down. Two hundred.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: What are you doing? Two fifty is already the discounted price.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Will you shut up?

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Tell you what, I’ll go two thirty-five.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Nope. Maybe another time.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Okay, two twenty five, my final offer.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Take it, take it.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Two hundred.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Man, you’re killing me!

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Killing you? I can’t breathe.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Two ten, and I’m losing money.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, now, we can’t let him lose money, Leonard. I’m so sorry.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Two ten and you throw in the Iron Man helmet.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Are you crazy? That helmet’s signed by Robert Downey Jr.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: So?

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Okay, if you’re going to question the importance of an actor’s signature on a plastic helmet from a movie based on a comic book, then all of our lives have no meaning!

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Okay, fine. Just the sword, two ten.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Thank you. I can eat meat this week.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: See that? I just saved us forty bucks.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I’ve long said, what you lack in academic knowledge you make up for in street smarts.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: You want me to wrap it?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: No, it’s okay. I’m gonna stab my friend in the chest.

turns.speaker: (entering)
turns.transcript: Hey, Stuart.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Ah, hey, Wil.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Hello, Wil Wheaton.

turns.speaker: Wil
turns.transcript: Hi, Sheldon. Nice sword.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: It’s part of my sword collection. Do you have a sword collection?

turns.speaker: Wil
turns.transcript: No.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I’m not surprised.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Here’s the Batman 612 with the Jim Lee alternate cover that you wanted.

turns.speaker: Wil
turns.transcript: Awesome. What do I owe you?

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Forty bucks.

turns.speaker: Wil
turns.transcript: Good deal.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Sucker. Didn’t even ask for the friends and family discount.

turns.speaker: Wil
turns.transcript: Hey, I’m having a party at my house on Friday, and I was hoping you would stop by.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Will there be girls there?

turns.speaker: Wil
turns.transcript: Yeah, of course.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: ‘Cause there wasn’t last time.

turns.speaker: Wil
turns.transcript: There will be girls. You guys are invited if you want to come by.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Thank you.

turns.speaker: Wil
turns.transcript: All right, great. Later.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I see what you’re doing. You accept an invitation to a party at the home of my sworn enemy, he tells everyone we’re going to be there, and when we don’t show, he looks the fool. Fiendishly clever.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I was actually thinking about going.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: And then declaring the party a fiasco and storming out, leaving him humiliated in front of his guests. Love it.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: No, I was gonna grab Raj and Howard and have a good time.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Oh, great, more guys. It’s gonna be another Wil Wheaton sausage-fest.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Here we are.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Hey. What are you trying to pull? The president of science isn’t in here.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: You lie down, he’ll be here in a minute.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Okay. Hey, I thought you were trying to trick me.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Now, you just get comfortable.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: No, no, comfort is the enemy. You know what’s comfortable? Slippers and blankets and panda bears. Imagine a panda bear with Richard Feynman’s face on it. Warm up the car, Leonard, it’s poster time.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Maybe in the morning.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yeah, you get some sleep.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: No, I don’t want to go to sleep, you can’t make me.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: You’re right, we can’t.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Yeah, darn straight, you can’t. Try to tell a grown man to go to sleep.

turns.speaker: (singing)
turns.transcript: Soft kitty, warm kitty.

turns.speaker: (singing)
turns.transcript: Little ball of fur.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: That’s not gonna work.

turns.speaker: (singing)
turns.transcript: Happy kitty, sleepy kitty.

turns.speaker: (singing)
turns.transcript: Purr, purr, purr.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: You know, he can be a lot of trouble, but when I see him lying here asleep like this, I just think how easy it would be to hold a pillow over his face.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Mmmm.

turns.speaker: (burping)
turns.transcript: Two, three, eight, four, six. (Normal) That’s all I can do without throwing up.

turns.speaker: Mike
turns.transcript: That is not what I expected when you said you were gonna burp pie.

turns.speaker: (off)
turns.transcript: Did somebody say pie?

turns.speaker: Mike
turns.transcript: I don’t know what’s scarier, the bathroom clowns or the woman that put them there.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: All I know is you can only fit one of her in a car. And there’s the clown that came out of her. I really didn’t want to come here, but this is shaping up to be one of the best Thanksgivings I’ve had in a long time.

turns.speaker: Mike
turns.transcript: Me, too.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Hey. Howie says you’ve been making fun of him all day. Now, both of you apologize right now.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: She’s so tiny. It’s funny when she’s mad.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: All right, mister, I think you owe Howard and Bernadette an apology.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Perhaps you’re right. I’m sorry for my behaviour. I’ve had alcohol, and it’s caused me to be inappropriate.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: It’s okay.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Don’t worry about it.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Thank you.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Ain’t she great?

turns.speaker: Mike
turns.transcript: Mmm.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Sheldon.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Now, how’s about you get us a couple of beers?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Here, drink slash eat this.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: What is it?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: It’s hot chocolate with a stick of butter.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Okay, why?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Because in the frigid temperatures in the Arctic, we need to consume at least 5,000 calories a day just to maintain our body weight.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Sheldon, you know I can’t eat butter. I’m lactose intolerant.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Way ahead of you, that’s an “I Can’t Believe It’s Not Butter” stick.

turns.speaker: webcam)
turns.transcript: But mummy, all the other guys are going to the North Pole.

turns.speaker: Koothrappali
turns.transcript: I don’t care what the other guys are doing. If the other guys jumped in the Bay of Bengal and tried to swim to Sri Lanka, would you follow them?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: If you were standing behind me nagging, I might.

turns.speaker: Koothrappali
turns.transcript: Don’t talk back to your mother. This trip is much too dangerous, Rajesh.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: No, it’s not. Howard, tell them.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Doctor and Mrs. Koothrappali, namaste. I understand your concern, but if it’ll make you feel any better, my mother is fine with me going, and this is a woman who kept a safety rail on my bed until I was 17.

turns.speaker: Koothrappali
turns.transcript: So, she has no problem with her son being eaten by a walrus?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: That’s very unlikely, Mrs. Koothrappali. If Raj dies, it’ll be from frostbite, gangrene, acute sunburn or being ripped to shreds by a fifteen hundred pound polar bear.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Ma, I’m putting you on speakerphone with Raj’s parents. Can you tell them that you’re okay with me going to the Arctic?

turns.speaker: Mother
turns.transcript: Arctic? I thought you said Arkansas!

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I didn’t say that. You never listen to me!

turns.speaker: Mother
turns.transcript: He doesn’t tell me anything! He lives a secret life because he’s ashamed!

turns.speaker: (arriving)
turns.transcript: Hey, Leonard, can I talk to you for a sec?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Sure, but let’s go out here where there’s a little less yelling and guilt. What’s up?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Well, I got you a little going away present.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, a blanket.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, no, no, no, not just a blanket. See, it has sleeves. Yeah!  So, you can, you know, be all snoodled up while you do your science stuff.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, wow, cool.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, I’m gonna miss you. (She hugs him for a long time) See you later.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Bye.

turns.speaker: Koothrappali
turns.transcript: I told you no. Why don’t you believe me?

turns.speaker: Mother
turns.transcript: ‘Cause it doesn’t make sense to me! How can it be that in the entire country of India, there isn’t one Outback Steakhouse?!

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Wait, let me see if I got this right. You actually asked Bernadette to leave your house in the middle of the night?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: What choice did I have? She went behind my back and turned my own mother against me.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Wow. You’re not only our first astronaut. You’re also the first one of us to kick a girl out of bed. You’re like a rock star.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Little bit.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I hate to say it, but she did kind of betray you.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Interesting. You see betrayal in others, but not yourself.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Going to Wheaton’s party is not betraying you.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, of course you would have to believe that. Evil always thinks it’s doing right. Excuse me, Stormtrooper. These are the droids you’re looking for.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I’m going to a party. I’m not turning R2-D2 and C-3PO over to the empire!

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Not yet.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: So, what’s gonna happen next? Are you and Bernadette going to break up?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I don’t know. If we’re going to get back together, she’s going to have to apologize and accept that I’m a grown man who can make his own decisions.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Then she’s going to have to convince your mother to let you go into space.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Obviously.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Here’s your tea.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh. Do not sneak up on a guy when he’s sitting on a log.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: You know, if you really want to be in nature, why don’t we rent a cabin?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Look, I’m sorry, when did you even get here? I…

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: You know, there’s a cabin in Big Bear that a doctor I work with keeps offering me.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Because he’s hitting on you?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: She.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, good.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: But I could get her.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: We could all go for the weekend. It’ll be fun.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Excuse me. Here, look up fun, get back to me.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: You and I could still go and have a nice weekend.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Sure.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Come on, Sheldon, let’s go with them.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I hardly think so. You be sure and say hello to all the mosquitoes, bees, bears, snakes, possums, poison oak, oh, and last, but not least, teenagers with guitars.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I’ll see if it’s available.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: You know, if that study’s real, Leonard might come back smarter than you.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Are you trying to manipulate me?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Yes.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well done, it worked, we’re going.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Yay.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Thanks again for having us.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Oh, of course. What did you guys want to talk about?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Well, you know, now that we’re engaged, we had some questions about how you handle money as a couple.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: I told you they weren’t gonna ask us to swing with them.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I didn’t think they were going to. I just wanted to have a way to say no without hurting Leonard’s feelings.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Well, nailed it.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: So what did you want to know?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Well, do you guys ever fight over money?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Sure, sometimes. I mean, it can be a little awkward since I make so much more money than Howie.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: You didn’t have to say so much more.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Well, I didn’t have to, but for the sake of accuracy I felt that I should.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I brought a lot of significant assets into the relationship, too.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Like what? Your incomplete set of Star Trek collector plates?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: For your information, I just bought the last one I needed on eBay.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Without asking me?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: There were only three minutes left in the auction and it was a mint condition Scotty from a smoke-free home.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: How much, Howie?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Not a lot.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: How much?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Let’s not talk about this in front of our friends.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Was it more or less than falconry school?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: For the tenth time, that was a Groupon.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Like I would swing with him.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Hey.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Okay, now that everyone’s here, we can begin.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Before we do, I just talked to Leonard. And if you’re gonna spend all your time trying to belittle me by making this class unnecessarily hard, then I’m out. But if you’re interested in making a sincere effort to be a good teacher, then I’m willing to give this a shot.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I suppose that’s a fair request. There’s no reason we both can’t benefit from this experience.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Okay.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Okay. Well, then, uh, first things first. Um, are you familiar with the Brachistochrone problem?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I am.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Good. And how it relates to the calculus of variations?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: It’s an inverted cycloid.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Wonderful. Now, what about Euler-Lagrange theorems?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: That’s where I’m a little fuzzy.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Ha! I knew it. All right. We have a lot of information to cover before your first test. Which, by the way, is in eight minutes. The good news is I’m grading on a curve, so you’re pretty much guaranteed a C.

turns.speaker: (singing)
turns.transcript: All I do is win, win, win no matter what.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: What are you doing?

turns.transcript: Uh, for the record, it could kill us to meet new people. They could be murderers, or the carriers of unusual pathogens, and I’m not insane, my mother had me tested.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: If we do get a new friend, he should be a guy you can trust. A guy who has your back.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: And he should have a lot of money, and live in a cool place down by the beach where we could throw parties.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: He should share our love of technology.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: And he should know a lot of women.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Yeah, let’s see, money, women, technology, okay we’re agreed, our new friend is going to be Iron Man.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: How old is this Jell-O?

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Well, it’s carrots, so gonna say very.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Sorry we have to do this.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Bernadette’s not wrong. She does work hard around here.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Yeah, maybe it’s a good thing if she stops babying you so much.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: She doesn’t baby me.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: I saw her pull you home in a wagon.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: For your information, I twisted my ankle chasing the ice cream truck.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Face it, dude, Bernadette treats you the same way your mother used to, and that was not a healthy relationship.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: You’re right. It’s time for me to act like an adult in this marriage. Starting with my husbandly duty of taking out the trash. Bernie, I made a mess.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: You think he bites?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Stick your head in there and find out.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: You fooled me with that goat at the petting zoo. You will not fool me again.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I wonder where Dr. Lorvis is. He’s been gone a while.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Maybe he’s playing bingo with his mommy.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: It’s sad how some guys can’t cut the apron strings.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Okay, now you’re messing with me.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Uh, guys, we’re locked in here.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, this day just keeps getting better.

scene: The apartment. Sheldon is working on his laptop. Spock is looking at him judgementally. He switches the two toys.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, I don’t want a broken toy. (Switches them back again. Penny and Leonard enter.) Nothing!

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: What?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Nothing. I said nothing.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: That was weird.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Really? I don’t even notice any more.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I cannot believe you guys aren’t going to play with these.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Well I told you, you don’t, it’s mint in box.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I dunno. I just think it’s a waste. (Picks up box. Sheldon screams.) Relax. I’m just looking at the box.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Perhaps you should look with your eyes, and not your muscular Nebraska man-hands.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: What is your problem?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: My problem is that I don’t want you to break Leonard’s toy, which you probably did by shaking it. She shook it. We all saw her.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Leonard, I bought you this because I wanted you to have fun with it. I don’t want it to just sit in this box.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: You know, you’re right. I mean, it’s from you, I’m never going to sell it. I’m opening it.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yes.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Mmmmm!

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: It’s broken.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: What?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, nice job, man-hands.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I didn’t break it. I, I guess Stuart sold it to me like this.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Yes. Yes, he did, that is a perfectly satisfying and plausible explanation. Yeah, let’s all be mad at Stuart.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: You know, I paid a lot for this. Let’s take it over there and show him.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Absolutely.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Wait. It was me. I opened your toy, discovered it was broken and didn’t tell you.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Why would you open mine?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I didn’t. That was a lie. I opened my own toy. And it was already broken so I switched them.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Well, you should talk to Stuart.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I can’t because that was a lie. Yours was broken in an earthquake. And that’s a lie.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: What is the truth?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: My Mr Spock doll came to me in a dream and forced me to open it. And when the toy broke I switched it for yours. Later he encouraged me to do the right thing and I defied him. And then I was attacked by a Gorn.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Okay, that I believe.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Mmm.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Leonard, Penny, I just, I want you both to know that I regret my actions toward the two of you. That’s a lie.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: So, is that one mine.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Yes.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Well, hand it over so I can open it.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Okay. Leonard, even though I don’t have one any more, I hope you have fun playing with it.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: And that’s a lie, right?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Big fat whopper. I hope it breaks.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: (Knock, knock, knock) Penny? (Knock, knock, knock) Penny? (Knock, knock, knock) Penny?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: What?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Move. Move. Move!

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Okay, who’s ready for some science? Me, too. Okay, I am Dr. Leonard Hofstadter. I am here with my friends Dr. Cooper and real-life astronaut Howard Wolowitz, and we are going to show you girls how cool a job in science can be. How cool, you ask? Well, how about negative 273 degrees, ’cause that’s the temperature at which entropy reaches its minimum value. Did I just learn something new and have fun doing it? What? All right. So now let’s bring out theoretical physicist Dr. Sheldon Cooper.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Hello, female children. Allow me to inspire you with a story about a great female scientist. Polish-born, French-educated Madame Curie. Co-discoverer of radioactivity, she was a hero of science, until her hair fell out, her vomit and stool became filled with blood, and she was poisoned to death by her own discovery. With a little hard work, I see no reason why that can’t happen to any of you. Are we done? Can we go?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: The thing to remember is you can go to outer space, too. I mean, look at me. I went to this very school. Those desks you’re sitting in, I was once superglued to one of them.

turns.speaker: Girl
turns.transcript: Did you go to the moon?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: No, but I did go to the International Space Station.

turns.speaker: Girl
turns.transcript: Did you fly the rocket?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: No, but I was in the rocket. I didn’t actually…

turns.speaker: Girl
turns.transcript: So you just flew around? That’s kind of like my uncle. He’s a flight attendant.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: No, I’m an American hero. Your uncle brings people nuts, okay?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Alright, alright. Boy, we are learning a lot here, huh? Thank you, astronaut Howard. Um, I am what’s called an experimental physicist, which is super-fun, because I get to test theories and work with lasers. Yes?
How did you decide to become a scientist?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Uh, excellent question. Um, I suppose I’ve always been into science, you know. My mother and father are scientists, so I was kind of led in that direction. Uh, pushed might be a better way to describe it. To be honest with you guys, when I was your age, I wanted to be a rap star. Like Snoop Dogg, but with a healthy respect for the police. Yeah, no, sure, you laugh. Just like my mother did. After I confided, I was derided and chided, my moms and I collided. She said my dreams were misguided. That’s just a little freestyle.

turns.speaker: phone)
turns.transcript: Howie, stop. I can’t talk like that. Amy’s right here.

turns.speaker: phone)
turns.transcript: Sheldon, stop. For the last time, I will not bring home bed bugs.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: The hotel’s nice. There’s a pool, a gym, the bar looks like fun.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Because I looked in the bed, and there are no bugs.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Aw, I love you, too. If I don’t talk to you before you go to sleep, I’ll meet you in dreamland.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Good night. No, I will not consider sleeping in my garment bag.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: The place looks great. Did you guys get a maid?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Kinda.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Dinner’s almost ready. If you like meatloaf, I’m sure you’ll like its cousin, bowl of meat.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Hey, if you’re still looking to make money, I will pay you to burn that jacket.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Thank you, but it doesn’t look like I’m going to Comic-Con this year.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well, with as much debt as you have, probably not next year either.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Howie?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Sure. This is for you.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: What’s this?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: It’s back pay for all the babysitting and taking care of Halley you’ve done.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: There’s more than enough in there to cover Comic-Con.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: Um, I also take care of Halley.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: And you live here for free.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: I do, ma’am, thank you, ma’am.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: This is so generous of you, I, um, I don’t know what to say.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Now you can come with us.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yeah, there’s room in the bed by Sheldon’s feet.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: As much as I appreciate this, I can’t accept it, okay? Halley’s my goddaughter, I don’t take care of her for money.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: I would.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Keep it. Consider it a gift.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Hold on. Is it back pay or is it a gift?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: What’s the difference?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: When the IRS questions us in separate rooms, we need to have our stories straight.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: It doesn’t matter. I’m not keeping this. I’m trying to pay my own way and be responsible. Taking handouts won’t help that.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: So you’re not going to Comic-Con?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: I’ve been plenty of times. If I miss one, it’s fine. I’m a big boy.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I’m a big boy, and if I missed one, I’d throw a big-boy tantrum.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: You know what? I’ve gone 12 times. Maybe I’ll sit out this year, too.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Really?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Yeah. Maybe you and I can do something fun that weekend.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Ooh, how about white-water rafting?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, how about we compromise and go on the Small World ride at Disneyland?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: You know what, I’m not gonna go either. I’m a father now. I’d rather spend time with my family.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: You just don’t want to go alone with Sheldon.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I’m gonna go check on dinner.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Sounds like everyone’s staying home. What do you say?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Nuts to that, I’m going to Comic-Con.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: By yourself?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Not necessarily. I have four months to find some new friends.

turns.speaker: Stuart
turns.transcript: I’ll go with you.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: That’s very kind of you, Stuart. Check back in with me in July.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: What happened with Leslie, why did she dump you?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I don’t know. She just said Howard, momma’s a rolling stone. And then her call waiting beeped and she was gone.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I don’t understand. If you were in a non-emotional relationship then why are you having  what appears be an emotional response?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Sheldon, he obviously had feelings for her.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Of course I had feelings for her, I saw her naked for God’s sake!

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Okay, uh look, you just need to get your mind off it. Do you want to go to the comic book store? Maybe go see a movie?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I don’t want to go anywhere.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You know, I’m given to understand that there is an entire city in Nevada designed specifically to help people like Howard forget their problems. Where  you can replace them with new problems such as alcoholism, gambling addiction and sexually transmitted diseases.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Is it me, or was that Sheldon’s way of saying Vegas baby!

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I’ve never been there, have you?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Me? No. I just got Vegas baby from Vince Vaughn in Swingers. .

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: It could be fun. I know my weekend’s wide open, now that…

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Okay, then let’s do this, lets go to Las Vegas.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Now? Right now?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Why not? People do things right now all the time. Why can’t we be right now people too. Go home, pack a bag and we’ll be right now people. I have to stop at the drug store to refill a prescription, but after that we’ll go right now.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: What do you say, Howard?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I say Vegas baby!

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: What are you going to tell your mother?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Sea World, baby!

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Hey, Sheldon, are you coming?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I’d rather have a blowfly lay eggs and hatch larvae in my auditory canal.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Great, we’ll bring you back a tee-shirt.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Well, ladies, we killed the bottle.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: I had half a glass.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: I didn’t have any.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay, don’t judge me. So, what do you want to do, go to the movies, go dancing, lay down for a little bit?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Or we play Travel Twister.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Amy, really? Twister?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Excuse me. I’ve passed many an enjoyable evening playing this game. And I’m sure it’s a lot more exciting when you play with other people. What do you say, bestie? We can do shirts and skins. I’m shirts. Called it.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: I’m too small for Twister. And roller coasters. And sitting with my feet on the floor. Hope you enjoyed the prenatal cigarettes, Mom.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Hey, you know, my mom smoked pot when she was pregnant with me, and I turned out just fine. Hey, look, I have peach schnapps. Thank God.

turns.speaker: phone)
turns.transcript: Guys, something happened.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: What’s wrong?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: I think a boy likes me.

turns.speaker: (reading)
turns.transcript: Hi. It’s Stuart. We met at the comic book store. I was wondering if you’d like to get coffee sometime. It’s okay if you say no. It might be the kick in the pants I need to start taking Zoloft.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Amy, little vixen. Just working it under all those layers of wool and polyester.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: What are you going to do? Doesn’t he know you have a boyfriend?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, she doesn’t have a boyfriend, she has a Sheldon. So do you like Stuart?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: I don’t know. He’s nice. He’s funny. He has the sallow, drawn countenance associated with an overactive thyroid gland. That’s kind of hot.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay, look, sweetie, we all love Sheldon, but you’ve been with him over a year now. If it’s not going anywhere, what does it hurt to look around?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Well, yeah, I guess they’re not engaged like me and Howie.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yeah, for what it’s worth, engaged people can look around, too. Lot of options out there.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, hey.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Hey.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: New shirts?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Yeah, a couple.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Nice.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Thank you.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: So, who’s the girl?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I’m sorry?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Well, last time you bought a new shirt was when we were dating.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: So, uh, what we did was in fact dating?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Well, yeah, we did have a date.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Exactly. Thank you. Do me a favour, tell Koothrappali that next time you see him.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: So, who is she?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, she’s a doctor.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, nice. A doctor doctor, or a you kind of doctor?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Doctor doctor. Surgical resident. Smart, pretty. Let me ask you something. If your friend thinks he’s dating someone, but he’s not because, in fact, you’re dating her, does that make you a bad person?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Well, that depends.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: On what?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Is that friend Wolowitz?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Yeah.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Screw him. You’re fine.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Well, have you slept with her yet? You dog! Good for you.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Does that change things?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: No.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: So why’d you ask?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I’m nosy. See ya.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Ooh, this one looks nice.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: No. Sheldon doesn’t like reclaimed wood.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Why not?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: He’s afraid the original owners will come back.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yeah. Well, Sheldon’s not here.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Well, he is here. So unless you want to dig him out with a bone saw and a melon baller, there’s nothing I can do about it.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: All right, sweetie, you’re paying for this table, and it’s your apartment, too.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I know, but…

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: No buts. You got to stop letting him boss you around.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: You’re right. I mean, he decides what TV shows we watch, what food we eat, who my favourite hobbit is. I wanted Frodo, but we can’t both have Frodo, so guess who’s stuck with Samwise Gamgee.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: See? Right there. You’re a grown man, you should be able to pick whichever hobbit you want. Wish you wouldn’t, but one problem at a time.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: You make a lot of sense. I like this table, and I’m getting it.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Really? This one?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: That one? Damn right I like that one.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: We’re pinned down.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: We can’t get through.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Sheldon, get over here and help.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Okay, one second.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Sheldon, why are you jumping up and down?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I’m trying to shoot.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Then use the shoot button, not the wonderful thing about Tiggers button.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Aw.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: That’s it, we’re dead.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Okay, challenge them again.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Doing it right now. Oh, they can’t. There’s an important Little League game tomorrow.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: No wonder they beat us, they’re jocks.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: What happened to me? I used to excel at these things.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Kids are always better at video games.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well, I don’t like it.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Mm, if it makes you feel better, you still dress like a child.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: No, but it’s not just video games. I downloaded the new O.S. for my phone, took me a week to stop accidentally texting kissy faces to everyone.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Oh, so our love is not real?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Well, I know how you feel. I tried one of those electronic Japanese toilets, practically shot myself across the room.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I guess I just need to face it, I’m no longer a wunderkind. Now I just wonder what’s for lunch.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Hot dogs.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Yay.

turns.speaker: (off)
turns.transcript: Who’s that? Is it a sex criminal?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Nobody wants to do that to you, Ma.

turns.speaker: Wolowitz
turns.transcript: Where were you?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Didn’t you read my email?

turns.speaker: Wolowitz
turns.transcript: You know I can’t turn on that ferkakta computer. I left you some brisket on the kitchen counter.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Thank you.

turns.speaker: Wolowitz
turns.transcript: Remember to floss after. We have the dentist in the morning!

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: This movie baffles me every time we watch it.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well, the instructions are very clear, don’t feed the gremlins after midnight, don’t get the gremlins wet. How hard is that?

turns.speaker: (arriving)
turns.transcript: Hi, guys. Hi, honey.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Hey.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Ooh, we’re honey now, are we?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Yes. Since their relationship became carnal, Penny has upgraded his designated term of endearment, thus distinguishing him from those she calls sweetie, usually in an attempt to soften a thinly-veiled insult.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: You’re boring people sweetie.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Although, sometimes, she omits the veil entirely.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: So, what are you guys doing?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Celebrating Columbus Day.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: We’re watching Goonies, Gremlins and Young Sherlock Holmes. They were all written by Chris Columbus.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay. What do you watch on Thanksgiving?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: The parade.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, you know, that reminds me, I usually go back to Nebraska for thanksgiving, but this year they’re calling it off on account of my brother’s trial.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: What’s he on trial for?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, just a big misunderstanding. You know, you’d actually like my brother, he’s kind of a chemist. Anyway, I was thinking I’d have thanksgiving here, and you are all invited.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh. I’ll be there.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Will you be serving cranberry jelly or cranberry sauce?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I guess I could serve both.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You guess? You don’t seem to have much of a handle on this.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Yeah, I really wish I could, Penny, but every year my mother has all the relatives over and cooks up her famous tur-briska-fil.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Tur-briska-fil?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Turkey stuffed with a brisket stuffed with gefilte fish. It’s not as good as it sounds.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Raj, what about you?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Oh, he usually comes to my house. Right, pal? (Raj bursts into tears and runs away) All right, this year, you don’t have to eat the tur-briska-fil. I don’t even chew it. I swallow it like pills.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay, so Kim the night manager went on maternity leave, and her husband’s name is Sandy, right? So get this, her replacement is a woman named Sandy whose husband’s name is Kim.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Wow!

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I know. What are the odds?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Easily calculable, we begin by identifying the set of married couples with unisex names. We then eliminate those unqualified for restaurant work, the aged, the imprisoned and the limbless, for example. Next we look at…

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Sheldon! it’s an amazing coincidence, can we leave it at that?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I’m sorry. Ooh, Penny, it’s as if the Cheesecake Factory is run by witches.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Ooh, Sheldon, it’s as if you don’t think I’ll punch you.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Come on, you guys, let it go.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Fine, whatever. Are you finished?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well, thank you. How thoughtful. Would you like a chocolate

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Um, yeah, sure, thanks.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: What was that?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You said be nice to Penny. I believe offering chocolate to someone falls within the definition of nice.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: It does. But in my experience, you don’t.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: There are more things in heaven and earth, Horatio, than are dreamt of in your philosophy.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Yeah, yeah, now that’s you, obnoxious and insufferable.

turns.speaker: gear)
turns.transcript: What’s going on, day dwellers?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, man, did the Kiss Army repeal don’t ask, don’t tell?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: No. Raj and I are going a goth club in Hollywood to hang with the night people. Anybody want to come along?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, wow, you’re actually going out like that?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: No, no. I’m going out like this. (Whips off jacket to reveal tattoos up both arms)

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Howard, what did you do?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: They’re called tattoo sleeves. Look. I bought them online, Raj got a set, too. Fantastic, right? Put them on, have hot sex with some freaky girl with her business pierced, take them off, and I can still be buried in a Jewish cemetery.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You know, I’ve always wanted to go to a goth nighclub.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Really?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Bazinga! None of you ever see my practical jokes coming, do you?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Okay, how about you two? Look, I’ve got some extra tat sleeves.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Why are you carrying extras?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Well, In case I snag one on someone’s nipple ring.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Uh, yeah, I think we’ll pass.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Oh, is the missus speaking for the couple now?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: In this case, you bet she is.

turns.speaker: whispers)
turns.transcript: Yes, she’s pushy and yes, he’s whipped, but that’s not the expression. Come on, I want to stop at Walgreens and pick up some more eyeliner.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: They’re gonna get beaten up at that club.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: They’re gonna get beaten up at Walgreens. Oh, sorry, Sheldon, I almost sat in your spot.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Did you? I didn’t notice. Have a chocolate.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Thank you.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I don’t think the manager’s coming tonight so, here.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Are you suggesting I sleep on the couch.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Well, it wasn’t the first suggestion that came to mind, but it’s the one I’m going with.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I can’t sleep on your couch. I sleep in a bed. And given it’s dimensions I have no intention of living out E.M. Snickering’s beloved children’s book , The Tall Man From Cornwall.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: What?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: There was a tall man from Cornwall whose length exceeded his bed. My body fits on it, but barely upon it, there’s no room for my big Cornish head.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, alright. I will give you my bed on one condition. That you promise to zip your hole for the next eight hours.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: May I say one last thing.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Only if it doesn’t rhyme.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Alright. Goodnight.

turns.transcript: I got you a little something.

turns.transcript: A little something? Oh, it… what, this is huge.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: What’s huge is what you’ve done for me.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, no, Amy, I haven’t done anything.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: No, no, before I met you, I was a mousy wallflower. But look at me now. I’m like some kind of downtown hipster party girl. With a posse, a boyfriend and a new lace bra that hooks in the front, of all things. Open it. Open it.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay. (Opens parcel to find a huge and not at all flattering painting of Penny and Amy)

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: I wanted to get you something you didn’t have.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Wow. I-I don’t know what to s… Wow.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Do you like it?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Do I like it? Wow.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: So, uh, where are you gonna hang it?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, my God. Hang it. Wow. Um, you know, I’d have to go get a hook and nails and a hammer and…

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: No problem.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, look. You, huh, you just, you got it all right there. Wow.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I got pretty exciting NASA news today. Next week I fly to Houston for orientation and zero-gravity elimination drills.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: What does that mean?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: He’s gonna learn to poop in space.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Open the pod bay doors, HAL.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Maybe your nickname should be Brown Dynamite.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Hello, dear friends. And Dr. Hofstadter.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: ‘Sup?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: ‘Sup? My apologies. I would’ve been here sooner, but the bus kept stopping for other people to get on it.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: I saved you a dumpling.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, your concern for me is touching. It will serve you well when you take me to the dentist tomorrow.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: I’m sorry, Sheldon, I’m busy. I’m right in the middle of my addiction study. I’ve got a lab full of alcoholic monkeys, and tomorrow’s the day we switch them to O’Doul’s.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You’re my girlfriend and you’re not going to cater to my every need? Oh, where’d the magic go?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Sheldon, that’s not what girlfriends are for. Although, you don’t use them for what they’re for, so what do I know?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Howard doesn’t make me do his shopping, or take him to the dentist, or pick up his dry cleaning, right?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Absolutely. But when Ma’s hips give out, you’re up, kid.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well, if Amy’s too busy, that gives the rest of you an opportunity to make my life easier, thus assuring yourselves a footnote in my memoirs, tentatively entitled You’re Welcome, Mankind. All right, then, just shout when you hear the task you want to undertake. Uh, dentist. Okay, we can circle back to that one. Um, well, who wants to take me Wednesday morning to get new heels put on my dress shoes? Anyone? Oh. That one had hoot written all over it. Um, all right, uh, dermatologist? Allergist? Podiatrist? Supercuts? Okay, okay, here’s a fun one. Um, I need a new picture frame and I have a hankering for Swedish meatballs. Who wants to spend the day with me at IKEA?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Their meatballs are pretty good.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: What’s that?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Nothing, nothing.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: A hush falls over the crowd as Cooper studies the board. He makes his move. He’s dividing both sides by I. He’s adding back the coefficient. He has a value for P. He’s plugging that back in. He takes the derivative, and he solves the equation. The crowd goes wild. Nobel! Nobel!

turns.speaker: Kripke
turns.transcript: Cooper?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Nobel. Kripke. Don’t look at my board.

turns.speaker: Kripke
turns.transcript: What’s that?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: That’s a drawing of a really cool train. Don’t look at that, either. What do you want?

turns.speaker: Kripke
turns.transcript: I have some bad news. You’re working on a gwant pwoposal fow a new fusion weactow. I’m working on a gwant pwoposal fow a new fusion weactow. The university is only awowed to submit one pwoposal.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: So they asked you to pack up your things and ship out. That’s hard cheese, Barry. You’re one of the good ones.

turns.speaker: Kripke
turns.transcript: No, they’re making us work together.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: That’s ridiculous. I am one of the great minds of our generation. I work on a level so rarified you couldn’t even imagine it. I said stop looking at my cool train!

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: All right, this is everything. What do you want to learn?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: It really doesn’t matter, as long as it’s challenging.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Okay, well, how about, oh, I teach you some close-up magic.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Howard, I’m trying to make myself uncomfortable, not everyone else.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: So you wanted to learn something physical and you came to Howard Wolowitz?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Hey, the circus arts are very physically and mentally demanding. Have you ever tried to juggle?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Yes, I’m juggling my love for you and my embarrassment of you right now.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: And it’s hard, isn’t it? So the key is, the moment one ball is at the top of its arc, you toss the next one. Hmm?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Okay, I think I got that.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Uh, hold on. There’s an old saying in juggling.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Is it I’m going to die alone?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: No, it’s if you want to have fun, start with one. Yours we think, but we do not say. All right, just toss it up and catch it a few times, get comfortable with it.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Okay. Just to be on the safe side, am I in any danger of getting juggler’s elbow?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: No.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Are you sure? ‘Cause I’m feeling a twinge.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: (Knock, knock, knock, knock) Leonard, (Knock, knock, knock, knock) Leonard, (Knock, knock, knock, knock) Leonard, (Knock, knock, knock, knock) Leonard, (Knock, knock, knock, knock)…..

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oooaw. This would be so much easier if I were a violent sociopath. (Opening door) What?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I was analysing our lie, and I believe we’re in danger of Penny seeing through the ruse.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: How?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Simple. If she were to log on to www.socalphysicsgroup.org/activities/other, click on upcoming events, scroll down to seminars, download the pdf schedule, and look for the seminar on molecular positronium, well then, bippidy-boppidy-boo, our pants are metaphorically on fire.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well, sir, my trousers will not be igniting today.

turns.transcript: Gentlemen.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Hey.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Hey.

turns.transcript: Hello.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Penny and I have dinner reservations that night, but any other time, no.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Sorry, Bernie and I are breaking in the new hot tub, if you know what I mean.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Not a clue. Raj?

turns.speaker: Raj

turns.transcript: You don’t sound very excited about it.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Oh, I am, I am. I, I guess I’m still wondering if Emily and I are right for each other.

turns.transcript: Does this have to do with that girl you had coffee with?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Well, you say it like it’s easy. Have any one of you ever broken up with anyone?

turns.transcript: No.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Not really.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You know, uh, once I ordered an Uber by accident. I just got in and went somewhere.

turns.transcript: So, what’s the deal with your apartment? Why’s it taking so long?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Um, it was a drywall problem.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, no, what happened?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Well, the drywall got wet, and you do not want wet drywall because when drywall gets wet, it’s really more…

turns.transcript: Wet wall?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Or damp wall, just as bad.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Mm. So why don’t they just get more drywall?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Well, they went to get some, but the woman at the wall store said it was going on sale and they should wait because the savings…

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay, are you done? Bernadette told me your apartment’s ready.

turns.transcript: I was done at wet wall, but you wouldn’t let it go.

turns.transcript: But is Sheldon really believing all this crap?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Well, he started to question it, but then I fake sneezed on him and he ran to take a shower. Please don’t say anything, I feel terrible about this.

turns.transcript: Oh, don’t worry, I won’t.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Thanks.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: The woman at the wall store?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Let it go.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: That green bag is Dr. Cooper’s. Here’s an extra five. Make him wait. Oh. Right to the nap, huh? Okay? Uh, so, this Glenn guy. You say you went out with him for, like, a year.

turns.transcript: Do we really need to talk about my old boyfriend now?

turns.transcript: No. I guess not. What is he, like, six-four, six-five?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Six-seven.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Probably has a hard time finding a suit that fits.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Is something bothering you?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: No. It’s just…

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: What?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I’m just thinking. If you had sex with that guy, I mean, there’s nothing I can do here that will make any kind of impact.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Howard, it’s not a contest. I love you. I want to be with you.

turns.transcript: Yeah, great, love you, too, but, if it were a contest, I wouldn’t have a chance, right?

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: You can’t think that way.

turns.transcript: Yep. Loser.

turns.transcript: Howard, stop it.

turns.transcript: Sorry. I just never figured that a guy like me going out with a girl like you would ever have to compete with a guy like that.

turns.transcript: Wait a minute, a girl like me? What’s that mean?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I’m… I…

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Are you saying you don’t think I’m hot enough to go out with a guy like Glenn?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: No! No, I’m saying exactly the opposite.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: I’m too hot to go out with a guy like Glenn?

turns.transcript: Yeah, let’s go with that.

scene: A hospital room. The guys except for Sheldon are in Hazmat suits.

turns.transcript: Mountain Elf.

turns.transcript: Don’t beat yourself up. That’s what I’m here for.

turns.transcript: You’re such a child.

turns.transcript: I have to say, this is the best Top Ramen you’ve ever made.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I discovered a secret ingredient. The flavour packet. That sucker is well named. All right, lover boy, get ready, ’cause there is a crap storm of romance coming your way.

turns.transcript: Oh, rose petals.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay, I gave this a lot of thought, and I finally found something to show you how much I love you.

turns.transcript: Oh, wow.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: It’s a first edition of Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy. I remember it was your favourite book growing up.
