turns.transcript: Nice to meet you too.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Oh, uh, these are my, my friends. This is Bernadette.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Hello.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: And this is Howard.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Nice to meet you.

turns.speaker: Lakshmi
turns.transcript: You too.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Please have a seat. (To Bernadette) I’m thinking double wedding!

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: (Knock, knock, knock) Amy? (Knock, knock, knock) Amy? (Knock, knock, knock) Amy?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Seven o’clock, right on time.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: It’s not an accident. I waited outside your door for twenty minutes.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Well, dinner’s almost ready.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I must say, I was surprised you chose to spend our date night in your apartment. As I mentioned, the Pasadena City Council is debating longer crosswalk times, and later, the LEGO store is having a midnight madness sale. You ask anyone, that’s a hot date.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Tempting choices, but I have something special planned for tonight.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: What can be more special than having an adequate amount of time to cross the street on your way to buy a tiny LEGO Indiana Jones?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: With our friends moving forward in their relationships, I’ve decided that we should make progress in ours as well.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, dear Lord. Two years ago, we didn’t even know each other, and now I’m in your apartment after dark. How much faster can this thing go?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: I had a feeling you’d be reluctant, which is why I’m going to dip into my neurobiological bag of tricks.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, you brain monkeys kill me. Dip away.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: I have devised an experiment that I believe will increase your feelings for me in an accelerated time frame.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: And how do you propose to do that? Uh, hope you’re not thinking about some sort of LSD thought control. Because there’s only one mind-expanding drug that this man enjoys, and that’s called school.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Human beings form emotional attachments as they grow up. In your case, to your mother, superheroes, et cetera. I’m going to attempt an experiment that will get you to transfer those feelings to me.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well, seems what’s on the menu tonight is malarkey with a big side of poppycock.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: We’ll see. Let’s start with a little romantic dinner music, shall we?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Super Mario Bros. theme?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Yes.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I see what you’re doing. You’re attempting to build on the work of Ebbinghaus by triggering an involuntary memory of me playing that game, admittedly the happiest 600 hours of my childhood, but it won’t work.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Fine. There’s no reason we still can’t have a lovely dinner. Why don’t you have a seat.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Da-da-da da-da dum, boink, boink.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: May I offer you something to drink?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You know I don’t drink.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Not even strawberry Quik?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I love strawberry Quik. It’s my favourite pink fluid, narrowly beating out Pepto-Bismol.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Oh, I know. I think it will go nicely with what I have prepared for dinner.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Spaghetti with little pieces of hot dog cut up in it!

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Just like your mommy used to make.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh yummy, yummy! We should do this more often. Uh-oh.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: So, afternoon tea was a bust.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: On the bright side, every six-year-old there was jealous of my tiara. Not gonna lie, it felt good.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Let me ask you a question, when did you guys start feeling grown up? ‘Cause I am not sure I do.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Honestly, I thought when I got married I would, but I still kind of feel like I’m pretending. It doesn’t help that most of my clothes come from Gap Kids.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay, so I’m an adult, and the other day I saw an old man slip and fall down, and I laughed. I mean, I laughed hard. Like, like, out loud. If he was conscious, he would’ve heard me.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Gosh.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I know. One of the tennis balls came off his walker and bounced right off his head. I mean, I, I almost wet myself. I guess you had to be there.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: I think I have you both beat. Imagine trying to feel like a grown-up when you’ve never even been with a man.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay, sex is not what makes you a grown-up.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Yeah. Or you’d be the oldest one here.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Really? Is that how you talk to your mother?

turns.speaker: Waiter

turns.transcript: I’m sorry, I meant questions about the food.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Oh, of course. Um, is the seafood risotto being served on a train car with the original link-and-pin coupler or the Miller Hook and Platform?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Uh, I think we’re gonna need a minute.

turns.speaker: behind

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Get out of town.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Fun fact, I’m gonna jump off this train.

turns.speaker: phone)
turns.transcript: Yeah, honey, I’m still stuck at work. Really? Penny said that? Okay, it’s true. I’m sorry. I’ll see you at home. Yeah, yeah, I’ll put it on.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: I know, it’s weird, right?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Yeah. We should do it more often.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Oh, no. I mean, this is weird right now.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: (Phone text sound) Ah, it’s Penny.

turns.speaker: Amy

turns.transcript: Oh, doesn’t seem like it. She got Sheldon to go to a psychic with her.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: A psychic? He considers them not just mumbo jumbo, but extra-jumbo mumbo jumbo.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Well, Penny can be very persuasive. She’s gotten me to do a lot of things I wouldn’t normally do.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Because she has sex with you.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Yeah, she does.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Can I confess something? Once in a while, I get a little jealous of how close Penny and Sheldon are.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Really?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: I mean, not in a romantic way. It’s just, she really has some sort of connection with him.

turns.transcript: Well, well they’ve known each other a long time, and Penny grew up around horses, so she knows how to approach him without making him skittish.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Don’t get me wrong, I’m glad they’re friends. I just wish he’d be that comfortable around me already.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Well, it took him a long time to get comfortable around me, too.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Really? What did you do?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Something terrible in a former life? I don’t know.

turns.speaker: Bernadette

turns.speaker: (answering)
turns.transcript: Oh, hey guys, what’s up?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: It’s Halo night.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yeah. Okay. So?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Well, with Wolowitz spending all of his time with your friend Christie,

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: She’s not my friend. Friends do not get their friends care bears all sweaty.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Right, anyway, uh, with Wolowitz occupied elsewhere, we had something we wanted to ask you. Sheldon?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Yes. Penny, we would very much appreciate it if you would be the fourth member of our Halo team. I don’t think I need to tell you what an honour this is.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, that’s so sweet. But I’m going out dancing with a girlfriend.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You can’t go out, it’s Halo night.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Well, for Penny it’s dancing night.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You go dancing every Wednesday.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: No.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Then it’s not dancing night.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Look, why don’t I play with you guys tomorrow?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Tonight is Halo night, it’s like talking to a wall.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Alright, now Sheldon, you and I are about to have a problem.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Sheldon, remember, we role-played this.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Yes, but you didn’t portray her as completely irrational.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Alright fellas, I gotta go. Good luck.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Maybe we should have asked if we could go dancing with her and her girlfriend.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Okay, assuming we could dance, which we can’t, there are three of us and two of them.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: So?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: It’s the Chinese restaurant all over again. I assure you that cutting a dumpling in thirds is child’s play compared with three men, each attempting to dance with 67% of a woman.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Aaah, for God’s sake, Sheldon, you are driving me crazy.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Your anger’s not with me, sir, but with basic mathematics.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: No, I’m pretty sure my anger’s with you.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: What’s happening to us? We’re falling apart.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Who are you calling?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: The only man who can restore any semblance of balance to our universe.

turns.speaker: (voice)
turns.transcript: Hi this is Howard Wolowitz.

turns.speaker: (voice)
turns.transcript: And this is Christie Van Der Bell.

turns.speaker: (voice)
turns.transcript: We can’t get to the phone right now because we’re having sex.

turns.speaker: (voice)
turns.transcript: You’re not going to put that on your message are you?

turns.speaker: (voice)
turns.transcript: No, I’m just kidding, I’ll re-record it. (beep)

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: So, have you ever spent a long time on a boat before?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Yeah.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: Are you referring to the time we got stuck on the Small World ride at Disneyland?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Yeah.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I’m proud of you, Leonard. Working out on the North Sea for months, that’s really something.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I know. As far as science goes, this is the adventure of a lifetime.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Maybe your lifetime. I went to space.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: It’s not a competition.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: You’re right, you’re right. I’m really proud of you, and I’m gonna miss you when you’re gone. And space beats water.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Rajesh, I thought Lucy was coming.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: She is. She’s just running a little late. You know how it is, girls always fussing about their hair, their makeup. She’ll be here. Just give it a rest, okay?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Um, can I have your attention, everyone? (Clinks glass) That’s, uh, B-flat, for those who don’t have perfect pitch. I would like to propose a toast to my best friend, Dr. Leonard Hofstadter. He has been presented with a wonderful opportunity, and I couldn’t be happier for him.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Thank you, Sheldon. That must’ve been very hard for you to say.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Well, I mean it. I’m really happy for you. And that’s how you get a toothpaste commercial. Cheers.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Cheers.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Cheers.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: It was really nice of you to try to be happy for Leonard.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Thank you.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: It must’ve killed you when I went to space.

turns.speaker: phone)
turns.transcript: Oh, no.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Buddy, you okay? Oh, man.

turns.speaker: Bernadette
turns.transcript: What’s going on?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Uh, go ahead. Read it.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Raj, I can’t come to the party. This is all just too much for me. I don’t think we should see each other any more. Sorry. Lucy.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Excuse me.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Raj, I’m so sorry.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Me, too.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: It did not kill me when you went to space. Monkeys went to space.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I hate it when you make me sit through all the credits.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Well, sometimes there’s a secret ending, like in The Avengers.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yeah, but I don’t think that’s going to happen in a documentary about the Holocaust.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: They could show bloopers. Oh, no.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: What is that?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: That is Sheldon’s “I’m unhappy and about to destroy the planet” music. Come on, let’s just go to your place.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Well, wait, if he’s unhappy,shouldn’t we talk to him?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Shouldn’t we talk to him? Have you learned nothing in six years?

turns.speaker: apartment)
turns.transcript: You doing okay, sweetie?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: There is ominous music playing, and there is an afghan over my head. I don’t know where you’re from, but where I’m from, that means I’m not doing okay.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Want me to make you some tea?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Tea is for when I’m upset. I’m not upset. The university’s forcing me to work with Kripke. I’m outraged.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: So, cocoa?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Yes, cocoa. Do you have any idea what it’s like to be paired with someone who’s so incredibly annoying?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, teacher! Me! Me!

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: See, I did all this great work, and now he’s just going to come along and ruin it. I am angrier than ever and filled with despair.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: What beverage do you make for that?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, no, no, no, I know this. Uh, hot apple cider with cinnamon sticks?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Yes, hot apple cider with cinnamon sticks!

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: When stuff like this gets me down, you know what I like to do?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Sing Hakuna Matata like an eight-year-old girl?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Wrong, smarty-pants. It’s Everything Is Awesome from The Lego Movie.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Look at these notebooks. They’re full of pages and pages of data. He clearly spent years on this.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Mmm. It’s just columns of random numbers. Toss it.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Well, but what if this was a potential breakthrough for him? What if, what if this is the thing that would’ve finally let him open that bottle of champagne?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Maybe he didn’t know what to pair champagne with. Strawberries, caviar, oysters. All good choices. Yeah, that look right there is why people eat before they come to your parties.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: This has to mean something.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Well, there’s no discernible pattern that I can see, but it shouldn’t be too hard to run the numbers and check.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Well, maybe we can get some time on the supercomputer.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Sure. We could try multiple regressions with varying physical and experimental constants.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, we could run a pattern-matching algorithm against well-known unsolved physics problems.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Ooh, it might be a substitution cipher. We could start with basic cryptanalysis.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Or we could talk to this guy he used to share an office with.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Oh, let’s do that.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Because you don’t know how to do cryptanalysis, do you?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Yeah, I’m not even sure if it’s the right word.

scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon enters in the French maid costume.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: What are you all staring at? Didn’t you ever see a man try to get a meeting with Stephen Hawking before?

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: Come on, let’s get you to bed. You’ve had a lot to drink.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: No more than Penny.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: That’s what I’m saying.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait. (Knock, knock, knock) Empty room. (Knock, knock, knock) Empty room. (Knock, knock, knock) Empty room. If somebody says come in, I’m gonna freak out.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Thank you so much for coming.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: You called the right person. I believe I have the perfect romantic evening for you to give Leonard.

turns.transcript: As I’m sure you’re aware, the quickest way to a man’s heart is through his…

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Oh. You poor thing. You have one arrow in your quiver, and you just can’t use it. Fortunately, another pathway to a man’s heart is through his stomach.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I don’t know if I want to cook for him. He’s kind of a picky eater. I mean, it’s too salty, it’s too dry, it’s too burnt and frozen at the same time. Okay, come on, what else would sweep you off your feet?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Well, I’ve always had this fantasy that involves dancing. The sexual chemistry between my partner and me is electric. But boy, oh, boy, does my father not approve until he sees us in the big dance competition.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay, that’s just the plot for Dirty Dancing. What else would you love? Other than being lifted over Patrick Swayze’s head.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Oh, oh, uh, you could, uh, stand outside his window with a boom box in the air.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: That’s from Say Anything.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Look, I’m a lonely guy, I watch a lot of movies. Look, Penny, if you truly want to be romantic, it needs to come from you.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I get that, but why is this so hard?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Well, you’ve probably never had to do this stuff ’cause you’re young and beautiful and men have always thrown themselves at you.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yeah, I’m trying to be sad about that. I can’t.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Oh, Penny, I hurt so bad.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I know, I know.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Sometimes I put the TV on mute just to pretend she’s still with me. But I can’t watch the closed captioning without crying.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, I’m so sorry. I wish I could make you feel better.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Seriously? I’m heartbroken and you’re hitting on me?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: What? No!

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Look, Penny, you’re great, but I had a long talk with my parents, and they said if I date an Indian girl, I get a Maserati.

turns.speaker: Director
turns.transcript: And action.

turns.speaker: Wheaton
turns.transcript: Please don’t shut me out.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Go away. Just go away.

turns.speaker: Wil
turns.transcript: I swear, I will find a way to turn you back.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: What gave you the right to mix my DNA with that of a killer gorilla?

turns.speaker: Wil
turns.transcript: I was trying to save your life.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Life? What life? Look at me, I’m a monster. And now I have blood on my hands, or paws. I don’t know.

turns.speaker: Wil
turns.transcript: You can’t give up. I love you.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: I love you, too. But I’m afraid I love killing more. Like, one day, I might actually try and kill you.

turns.speaker: Director
turns.transcript: And cut. All right. All right, let’s set up for the next scene.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Actually, you know what? Can we do one more? I think I could do it better.

turns.speaker: Director
turns.transcript: Let’s just move on. No one cares.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Well, I care. I mean, look, if we’re gonna do this, why not try and make it something we’re actually proud of?

turns.speaker: Director
turns.transcript: Look, sweetie, this movie is garbage, but you should be happy about that, ’cause if it was a good movie, you wouldn’t be in it.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Whoa, whoa, hang on. There’s no need to insult her.

turns.speaker: Director
turns.transcript: And who are you?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: I’m her boyfriend.

turns.speaker: Director
turns.transcript: Isn’t she too hot for you?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: A little, yeah.

turns.speaker: Director
turns.transcript: Well, boyfriend, get off my set.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: You can’t do that. He’s with me.

turns.speaker: Director
turns.transcript: You know what? You can get off my set, too. You’re fired.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: What? You can’t fire me. I’m the star. I’m the girl that goes bananas. It says so on the poster.

turns.speaker: Director
turns.transcript: Yeah, but we just shot the last scene where we see your face. So from now own, the star of the movie is whoever wears this.

turns.speaker: Wil
turns.transcript: Hey, if you’re gonna fire her, then you have to fire me, too.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: All right, we’re going to be designing an experiment to look for the annihilation spectrum resulting from dark matter collisions in space.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Ooh, dark matter. We better bring a flashlight. I was making a joke.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I’m the boss. I make the jokes.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Sorry, go ahead and make your joke.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: This is not the time for joking. We’re doing serious research, which requires complete and utter focus.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: All right, let’s buckle down and work.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Sheldon.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: What?

turns.transcript: I need an aspirin.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Top desk drawer.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Thank you.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Alright?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Yes.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Good.

turns.transcript: Oh hey.

turns.transcript: Oh, good. Do you have any fabric softener?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yeah, sure. What are you washing? A crocodile?

turns.transcript: No, the pants that Stephanie got me.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, sweetie, you can’t machine wash these. They’ll be ruined.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Absolutely.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Oh, no. I wish you’d told me that sooner.

turns.transcript: Are you guys having problems?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: No, everything’s fine.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Really?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Yeah. It’s wonderful. Okay, maybe this whole living together happened kind of suddenly, but it’s fine, it’s great.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay, Leonard, honey, you know, if you’re uncomfortable with the way things are going, you’re allowed to say something.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Are you sure? That doesn’t sound right.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Believe me, your feelings are just as important as hers.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: No that doesn’t sound right either.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Just tell her you need the relationship to move at a pace that you both are comfortable with.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Yeah, I could say something like that to her. I’ll go do that. Thank you.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Sure.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: You have a really good grasp on this. Maybe you could talk to her?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: You’re kidding, right?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: No, but that’s okay. I’ll go talk to her. Want to come with?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Go! Wow.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Yeah, we’re putting the play on for one night in this little 99-seat theatre. Can you come? Oh, great. Do you know 98 other people that might want to come? Oh, hang on. (Switches to another line) Hello?

turns.speaker: phone)

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Just a sec. (Switches back to first line) The theatre is above a bowling alley, so it’s a little noisy, but it might be the only chance I’ll ever get to play Anne Frank. And the director is brilliant. He uses the bowling sounds as, like, Nazi artillery. Okay, great, I’ll see you then. (Switches line again) Hello?

turns.transcript: He’s calling to ask you a favour. You might be confused because he didn’t use the words, Penny, Sheldon, please or favour.

turns.transcript: Okay. Enough chitchat. Okay, step one, locate your emergency key to our apartment. Step two, enter our apartment. Step three, enter my bedroom.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, hang on, Sheldon, getting another call.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: No! Leonard, let me tell you something. Personal robots cannot get here soon enough.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: And that bright little star peeking her head out early today, that’s Venus.

turns.transcript: That is so cool. You really know a lot about space.

turns.transcript: You’re not one of those guys who really believe that, are you?

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: You mean one of the hopeless geeks? No. Those are crazy people. Howard, be a dear and get me another one of these. Now, him, he’s one of those geeks.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: All right, now, before you enter my bedroom unescorted, I need you to understand that this onetime grant of access does not create a permanent easement. Easement. It’s a legal right

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Do you believe him? Normally around women, he has the personality of a boiled potato. Put one beer in him, and he’s M. Night Charmalarmalon.

turns.transcript: What?

turns.transcript: What’s going on?

turns.transcript: I don’t know. Some sort of placebo effect, I guess.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Placebo, you say. Interesting.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Yes, I’m still here. Where am I going? I’m on a train. Now, what you’ll be looking for is a small wooden box located between a Hoberman’s sphere and a sample of quartz flecked with pyrite. Hoberman’s Sphere. It’s a collapsible icosidodecahedron. No, the thing with the time on it is my alarm clock.

turns.transcript: You’re making that up.

turns.transcript: You got me. Now what are you going to do with me?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Raj.

turns.transcript: Yes?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Look.

turns.transcript: What am I looking at?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: You tell me.

turns.speaker: Raj
turns.transcript: Non-alcoholic bee-ee-eeuh (Runs off)

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Hi, I’m the small package good things come in.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay, I got a box, but there’s no key in here. Just letters.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: That’s the wrong box. Put it back.

turns.transcript: Oh, Sheldon, are these letters from your grandmother?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Don’t read those letters!

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Oh, look, she calls you Moon Pie. That is so cute.

turns.transcript: Put down the letters!

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Hey, Penny. It’s Leonard.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Hey, Leonard. How’s the train ride?

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Delightful. Listen, I don’t know what you’re doing right now, but there are little bubbles forming on the corners of Sheldon’s mouth.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay, yeah, I kind of crossed a line. Put him back on.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Thank you.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: I’m back.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: What up, Moon Pie?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Nobody calls me Moon Pie but Meemaw!

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Hey, Penny. Leonard again.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: So anyway, in the dream, you and I were ice skating, just the two of us. And then, I picked you up by your ankles and twirled you round and round until your legs tore off. I tried to stick them back on, but before I could, you turned into a giant loaf of pumpernickel bread. What do you think that means?

turns.speaker: (uncomfortable)
turns.transcript: I really don’t know.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: I’ll give you a little clue. My favourite sandwich? Salami on pumpernickel.

turns.transcript: Is that so?

turns.transcript: And did you know the word “pumpernickel” comes from the German words pumper and nickel, which loosely translates to fart goblin?

turns.speaker: Summer
turns.transcript: No. I didn’t.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Okay, I found the box. Now what?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: You’re holding a Japanese puzzle box, which takes ten precise moves to open. First, locate the panel with the diamond pattern and slide the centre portion one millimetre to the left. Then, on the opposite end of the box, slide the entire panel down two millimetres. You’ll hear a slight click.

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Hang on. Sheldon, do you have any emotional attachment to this box?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: No, it’s a novelty I ordered off the Internet. Now, did you hear the click?

turns.speaker: Penny
turns.transcript: Not yet. (Puts box on ground and stomps on it)There it is.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Okay, here’s another one. If you married the famous rock guitarist Johnny Winter, you’d be Summer Winter.

turns.transcript: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Okay, I’m going to just go for broke here and say I like you.

turns.speaker: Summer
turns.transcript: Yeah?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: So here’s my question, do you realistically see any conversational path that would take me from where we are right now to a place where I could ask you out and you’d say yes?

turns.speaker: Summer
turns.transcript: No.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Fair enough. I’ll leave you in peace.

turns.speaker: Summer
turns.transcript: Thank you.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: But before I go, would you mind if I just take one picture of us together for my Facebook page?

turns.speaker: Summer
turns.transcript: Sure.

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Okay. Great. Now, can I take one where it looks like we’re making out?

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Okay, now you’re going to insert the flash drive into the USB port. She calls me Moon Pie because I’m nummy-nummy and she could just eat me up, now, please put the flash drive in the USB port. The one that looks like a little duck’s mouth.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Hey, how’d it go?

turns.speaker: Howard
turns.transcript: Terminator broke my phone.

turns.speaker: Leonard
turns.transcript: Excuse me. (Goes down to Summer) Okay, I’ll be honest with you. I’ve just spent the last two hours imagining various scenarios in my head, trying to come up with some clever line to say to you. But then I finally realized you’re a human being; I’m a human being. I could just say to you…

turns.transcript: Next stop: Santa Barbara.

turns.transcript: I’m sorry. This is me.

turns.transcript: Hi, my name’s Leonard.

turns.speaker: Amy
turns.transcript: But Leonard’s idea was good.

turns.speaker: Sheldon
turns.transcript: Fine. Then Grumpy, what’s he so grumpy about? Maybe his girlfriend won’t take his side.
